column4: UPDATE 2-Tesla's Musk tells disgruntled shareholders: Buy Ford
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/DETROIT  April 12 A group of Tesla Inc investors has urged the luxury electric car maker to add two new independent directors to its board  without ties to Chief Executive Elon Musk  to "provide a critical check on possible dysfunctional group dynamics."

column4: Investors push for changes in Tesla board
column5: April 12 A group of Tesla Inc investors have urged the electric car maker to add two new independent directors who do not have any ties with Chief Executive Elon Musk.

* Diane Bryant  Murthy Renduchintala and Stacy Smith have been promoted to group presidents and Renduchintala has been appointed chief engineering officer Source text (http://intel.ly/2osYOIV) Further company coverage:

column4: BlackBerry awarded $814.9 mln in Qualcomm arbitration
column5: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc said it was asked to refund Canada's BlackBerry Ltd a sum of $814.9 million in an arbitration settlement over royalties for certain past sales.

column4: Qualcomm to pay BlackBerry $814.9 million to settle royalties dispute
column5: Chipmaker Qualcomm Inc said on Wednesday it was asked to refund Canada's BlackBerry Ltd $814.9 million in an arbitration over royalties for certain past sales.

column4: UPDATE 2-Qualcomm to pay BlackBerry $814.9 mln to settle royalties dispute
column5: * Does not agree with the decision - Qualcomm (Adds details  analysts comment)

column4: BRIEF-BlackBerry awarded $814.9 mln in Qualcomm arbitration
column5: * Qualcomm - announced binding interim arbitration award requiring co to refund a sum of $814.9 million  plus interest and attorneys' fees  to BlackBerry

column4: BRIEF-Blackberry awarded $814.9 mln in Qualcomm arbitration
column5: * Blackberry awarded U.S. $814 868 350.00 in arbitration against Qualcomm
